sentences.en: ‘Look!’ she said and pointed.
sentences.cn: “看呀！”她用手指着说道。

sentences.en: "Now then," Max said, "to get back to the point."
sentences.cn: “好吧”，马克斯说，“回到正题上来。”

sentences.en: [with clause]she pointed out that his van had been in the car park all day.
sentences.cn: 她指出他的小货车一整天都在停车场。

sentences.en: [with direct speech]‘Most of the people round here are very poor,’ I pointed out.
sentences.cn: 我指出，“这里的人多数都很穷。”。

sentences.en: A point of order was raised in parliament by Mr Ben Morris.
sentences.cn: 本·莫里斯先生在议会就程序问题提出质询。

sentences.en: At one point a bird trilled in the Conservatory.
sentences.cn: 有那么一刻，一只鸟儿在温室里啼叫。

sentences.en: At one point last week shares in the grey market touched 230p.
sentences.cn: 上周，灰市上的股票价格一度高达230便士。

sentences.en: By 1973, this gap had narrowed almost to vanishing point.
sentences.cn: 到1973年，这一差距已缩小到几乎为零。

sentences.en: He admits to having hit the lowest point in his life .
sentences.cn: 他承认自己跌到了一生中的最低谷。

sentences.en: He is three points behind the leader.
sentences.cn: 他落后领先者三分。

sentences.en: He stood up and pointed his finger at me.
sentences.cn: 他站起来，用手指指着我。

sentences.en: Here are the main points of the news.
sentences.cn: 以下是新闻摘要。

sentences.en: His prose is vigorous and dense, occasionally to the point of obscurity.
sentences.cn: 他的散文文笔有力、内容庞杂，有时几近晦涩。

sentences.en: I don't see the point in it really. It's just stupid.
sentences.cn: 我真的不理解这到底有什么意义，简直是愚蠢透顶。

sentences.en: I should point out that these estimates cover just the hospital expenditures.
sentences.cn: 我应该指出，这些估算仅包括医院的费用。

sentences.en: I suppose we could save one or two of the trees, but what’s the point ?
sentences.cn: 我想我们可以拯救一两棵树，不过那有什么意义呢？

sentences.en: It got to the point where he had to leave.
sentences.cn: 到了他不得不走的地步。

sentences.en: Let me just go back to the point I was making.
sentences.cn: 请允许我再回到我刚才所提的观点。

sentences.en: Make a point of backing up your files at regular intervals.
sentences.cn: 一定要定期备份文件。

sentences.en: She made some extremely good points.
sentences.cn: 她提出了一些很不错的观点。

sentences.en: She pointed in the direction of the car park.
sentences.cn: 她指着停车场的方向。

sentences.en: she was constantly trying to think of ways to score points off him.
sentences.cn: 她不断想法子占他的欺头。

sentences.en: That’s a very interesting point.
sentences.cn: 那个观点很有趣。

sentences.en: the ‘green revolution’ in agriculture is a good case in point.
sentences.cn: 农业上的“绿色革命”就是一个很好的恰当例子。

sentences.en: the ‘green revolution’ in agriculture is a good case in point.
sentences.cn: 农业上的“绿色革命”就是一个很好的恰当例子。

sentences.en: The argument contained herein takes exactly the opposite point of view.
sentences.cn: 本文所持的论点恰恰是站在相反的立场。

sentences.en: The pain originated from a point in his right thigh.
sentences.cn: 疼痛是从他右大腿的某处开始的。

sentences.en: The party's share of the vote fell by ten percentage points.
sentences.cn: 该党的得票率下跌了十个百分点。

sentences.en: The stock market has fallen by over 200 points in the last week.
sentences.cn: 在过去的一周内股市已经下跌两百多点。

sentences.en: The turning point in the process of growing up is when you discover the core of strength within you that survives all hurt.
sentences.cn: 当你从内心深处找到一种可以忍受一切痛苦的坚强力量时，你的成长历程就会出现飞跃。

sentences.en: There are three important points we must bear in mind.
sentences.cn: 有三个要点我们必须记住。

sentences.en: This brings me to my next point.
sentences.cn: 这样我就要讲到下一点了。

words.tran_cn: 尖的；突出的；锐利的；率直的
无意义的；钝的；不尖的；不得要领的
不相干地；漫无目标地；不得要领地（pointless的副词形式）
要点；得分；[语]标点；[机]尖端

phrases.tran_cn: 在各部分；在各方面；完全地
adv. 相关的；恰当的；中肯的
（清楚地，有说服力地）阐明观点
即将…的时候；即将…的；在…点上
[美国、加拿大英语]特指的时间
(主英)接受某人的观点（或立场）
(拳击)以得分高（而不是击倒对手）取胜

trans.tran_cn: 观点，要点，意义，目的，细节，特点，地点，时刻，尖，点，分，罗经点，插座
trans.tran_en: a single fact, idea, or opinion that is part of an argument or discussion

trans.tran_cn: 指（向）向，瞄准，勾缝，表明，强调
trans.tran_en: to show something to someone by holding up one of your fingers or a thin object towards it
